agency_desc: A commercial telecommunications company that offers government-sponsored Lifeline discounted telephone service.
service_description: Provides discounted landline phone services to eligible households in the Frontier service area. Lifeline provides a monthly discount on basic, local telephone service, as well as discounted line-connection fees and a waiver of deposit for new, local-service customers.
site_details: Call or visit website for an application. -- Mail or fax completed application along with any required documentation.
site_schedule: Customer Service Contact Center: Mon-Fri 7am-9pm; Sat 8am-6pm
site_eligibility: Households in Frontier telephone service area (includes telephone exchanges throughout Indiana) -- Household income at or below 135% Federal Poverty Level -OR- households receiving any of the following benefits: Medicaid -- Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)/food stamps -- Section 8 Housing Assistance -- Low-Income Energy Assistance Program (EAP) -- Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF)-- National School Lunch Program Assistance -- No one in household already receiving Lifeline discounted service (landline or wireless)
